did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections and Archives, George Mason University
did.unittitle: Arena Stage Collection: Production Notebooks and Programs
did.physdesc: 138 containers comprising 46 cubic feet (69 linear feet)

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Contact George Mason University Libraries, SCA for information.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Arena Stage Collection: Production Notebooks and Programs, George Mason University Libraries

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: Co-founded in 1950 by Zelda Fichandler, Thomas C. Fichandler, and Edward Mangum, Arena Stage was an early leader in the resident theater movement. Mangum, a teacher from George Washington University, and Zelda Fichandler, one of his students, opened the theater in Washington D.C. to fill the void left by the closing of the National Theater in 1948. Donated to George Mason University in fall of 2000, the Arena Stage Collection contains materials that span the theater's more than 50-year history including production notebooks, photographs, playbills, scrapbooks, and handwritten correspondence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Production notebooks and Programs for Arena Stage productions from 1950 to 1990. Notebooks contain playscripts, music and light cues, wardrobe, prop, notes, and stage-related information.
